content: Who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City during the High Renaissance period?

The artist who painted the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City during the High Renaissance period was Michelangelo Buonarroti, commonly known as Michelangelo. This monumental work was completed between 1508 and 1512, and it's considered one of the most significant works of art in history. The central part of the ceiling features nine scenes from the Book of Genesis, including the famous depiction of the Creation of Adam, where God and Adam's fingers almost touch.
